meanings.definition: To shuffle again or in a different way.
meanings.sent1: After playing cards, we needed to reshuffling the deck for the next game.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys reshuffling her playlist to discover new music.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved reshuffling the cards in a surprising order.
meanings.sent4: In life, we are constantly reshuffling our priorities to adapt to new challenges.
meanings.sent5: The wind kept reshuffling the fallen leaves on the sidewalk, creating a mesmerizing pattern.

meanings.definition: The act of shuffling again or in a different way.
meanings.sent1: The reshuffling of the cards confused the players during the game.
meanings.sent2: A reshuffling of the seating arrangement brought new energy to the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The reshuffling of the office supplies led to a comical mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The reshuffling of responsibilities at work felt like a fresh start.
meanings.sent5: The reshuffling of the puzzle pieces made it more challenging to complete.
